result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayvon Charles McAfee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Court orders restitution set at $0.
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
- Court ordered all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from bail on deposit.  Defendant ordered to pay remaining balance by 12/31/19.  Any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
- with GOOD TIME CREDIT, with credit for 6 days time served (TIME SERVED DISPOSITION).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clayvon Charles McAfee

records.addlTxt: - filed by Attorney Sargent.

Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
 
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 DAYS in the House of Correction with GOOD TIME CREDIT, with credit for 6 days time served (TIME SERVED DISPOSITION). 

Court orders restitution set at $0.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from bail on deposit.  Defendant ordered to pay remaining balance by 12/31/19.  Any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief.

Defendant Clayvon Charles McAfee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for plea hearing.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 1 AMENDED to Possession of THC, contrary to Wis. Stat. 961.41(3g)(e), a Misdemeanor.    
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to AMENDED COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

03/01/2019

Defendant Clayvon Charles McAfee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Clerk of Court: MMS.
Matter in Court for Status Conference held. Matter is in resolution posture, defense requests plea date.  Court GRANTS request. Defense does not wish to withdraw their previously filed motion. Court PENDS Defense's motion until the next court date.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 28, 2019 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
received and filed.
Court ORDERS bail set at $100.00 CASH BOND.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Clayvon Charles McAfee not in court, in custody. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Clerk of Court: MMS.  
Matter in court for return on warrant. Court hears bail argument. For reasons as set forth, Court orders bail set at $100.00 CASH BOND. Court ORDERED case scheduled for Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for March 12, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on February 23, 2019.  Bench Warrant scanned. OPD to reevaluate defendant for new counsel to be appointed. Case is adjourned to February 28, 2019, at 1:30 p.m. for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 35. Notice is given to OPD and ADA Johnson.

Original Transcript (10 pages) commencing PRELIMINARY HEARING 01-30-2015. Received and Filed.

Defendant Clayvon Charles McAfee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Clayvon Charles McAfee in custody.  Ron Dague for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case 12CF3566 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Zebdee Wilson State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Clayvon Charles McAfee in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Clayvon Charles McAfee in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
